newsitem.title: POLAND: POLISH CAR SALES GROWTH HIGHEST IN EUROPE - REPORT.
newsitem.headline: POLISH CAR SALES GROWTH HIGHEST IN EUROPE - REPORT.

text.p: New car sales in Poland jumped nearly 38 percent in the first nine months of 1996 compared with the same period last year, showing the biggest growth rate in Europe, a report by an independent monitoring agency showed.
A monthly survey by the Samar agency, which monitors the domestic car market, showed 289,474 new units were registered in January-September, compared with 210,088 in the same period last year.
Samar, quoting figures by the Journal of the Global Industry, said Poland led other European countries regarding new cars registration growth rate.
It said Poland was followed by Norway and Ireland, where cars registration growth reached 34.6 percent and 30.7 percent over the period with 95,800 and 106,100 units sold respectively.
Germany, ranking the first in the new car sales volume, registered 2,717,700 units in the January-September period, 8.5 percent more than last year.
In Poland, the domestic unit of Fiat Spa led the market with 104,097 cars and a 43.6 percent market share.
Other top sellers include Daewoo-FSO, a unit of South Korea's Daewoo Corp , General Motors' German unit Adam Opel AG and Czech Skoda .
Samar Director Wojciech Drzewiecki earlier said the robust cars sales was fuelled by growth in real wages and more attractive terms of bank financing of car purchases.
